data.question: What is the chemical formula for MUV-1-Cl(Co)?
What method was used for the synthesis of MUV-1-Cl(Co) and what was the heating temperature?
data.answer: The synthesis method involved combining cobaltocene and benzimidazole, sealed under vacuum in a layering tube, and heated at 150 °C for 4 days.

data.question: How was the phase purity of MUV-1-Cl(Co) established?
data.answer: Phase purity was established by X-ray powder diffraction.

data.question: What is the difference in the synthesis conditions between MUV-1-Cl(Co) and MUV-1-Cl(Mn)?
data.answer: MUV-1-Cl(Co) was synthesized using cobaltocene and benzimidazole at 150 °C, while MUV-1-Cl(Mn) was synthesized using bis(tetramethylcyclopentadienyl)manganese(II) and benzimidazole at 250 °C.

data.question: What technique was used to determine the thermal stability of the compounds?
data.answer: Thermal stability was determined by thermal gravimetric analysis (TGA) at a heating rate of 20 °C min–1.

data.question: What was the main characteristic observed in the SEM images of MUV-1-Cl(Co)?
data.answer: Well-defined rectangular edges were the main characteristic observed in the SEM images of MUV-1-Cl(Co).

data.question: How was the magnetic behavior of the compounds investigated?
data.answer: The magnetic behavior was investigated using SQUID magnetometer measurements, including direct current (dc) magnetic susceptibility, alternating current (ac) measurements, and Electron Paramagnetic Resonance (EPR) spectroscopy measurements.

data.question: What was the method used to obtain few-layer flakes of the compounds?
data.answer: Few-layer flakes of the compounds were obtained by mechanical exfoliation using an adhesive plastic film, commonly known as the Scotch-tape method.

data.question: What was the purpose of using Raman spectroscopy in the study?
data.answer: Raman spectroscopy was used to assess the nature of the mechanically exfoliated thin-layers and confirm their chemical composition.
